Quote: People will forget what you said and did, but they will never forget how you made them feel.
Author: Maya Angelou

Quote: I am not an angel, ' I asserted;' and I will not be one till I die: I will be myself. Mr. Rochester, you must neither expect nor exact anything celestial of me - for you will not get it, any more than I shall get it of you: which I do not at all anticipate.
Author: Charlotte Brontë, Jane Eyre

Quote: Lighthouses don’t go running all over an island looking for boats to save? they just stand there shining.
Author: Anne Lamott

Quote: Earth provides enough to satisfy every man’s needs, but not every man’s greed.
Author: Mahatma Gandhi

Quote: History is a vast early warning system.
Author: Norman Cousins, editor and author (24 Jun 1915-1990)

Quote: The American who first discovered Columbus made a bad discovery.
Author: Georg Christoph Lichtenberg, scientist and philosopher (1 Jul 1742-1799)

Quote: It's hard to be religious when certain people are never incinerated by bolts of lightning.
Author: Bill Watterson, comic strip artist (b. 5 Jul 1958) [Calvin & Hobbes]

Quote: All the arguments to prove man's superiority cannot shatter this hard fact: in suffering the animals are our equals.
Author: Peter Singer, philosopher and professor (b. 6 Jul 1946)
